Convert Nested Data Frames to a Flat Representation

Some functions (e.g., getJobPars, getJobResources or reduceResultsDataTable return a data.table with columns of type list. These columns can be unnested/unwrapped with this function. The values will be transformed to a data.frame and cbind-ed to the input data.frame x, replacing the original nested column.

flatten(x, cols = NULL, sep = NULL)

Arguments

x

[data.frame] Data frame to flatten.
cols

[character] Columns to consider for this operation. If set to NULL (default), will operate on all columns of type “list”.
sep

[character(1)] If NULL (default), the column names of the additional columns will re-use the names of the inner list/data.frame. If you provide sep, the variable column name will be constructed as “[column name of x][sep][inner name]”.

Value

[data.table] where nested columns are replaced with flattened columns.

Examples

x = data.table(
  id = 1:3,
  values = list(list(a = 1, b = 3), list(a = 2, b = 2), list(a = 3))
)
flatten(x)
#>       id     a     b
#>    <int> <num> <num>
#> 1:     1     1     3
#> 2:     2     2     2
#> 3:     3     3    NA
flatten(x, sep = ".")
#>       id values.a values.b
#>    <int>    <num>    <num>
#> 1:     1        1        3
#> 2:     2        2        2
#> 3:     3        3       NA

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Examples
